data.wikiTitle: Loss of user data or system disk
data.wikiData:
WARNING: Before performing this update, we recommend that you back up or make copies of all your important files to customers. Software update process is done entirely at the customer's risk. If done properly, there will be no loss of user data or system disk. However, if the software process is interrupted for any reason, solid-state drive may not function properly.

If the device is able to run Windows, ask them to download and install the latest Toshiba software XG5 available at Dell.com
data.author: BHARAT.BHUSHAN

data.wikiTitle: No power/ No boot, FAN Full speed
data.wikiData:
Check, against FAN wire is crushed/jammed with metal frame of top cover, as shown at the pictures.

If FAN cable is crushed/jammed, please order new FAN.

If replacement of FAN and proper leading of wires didn’t solve the issue, replace PCBA as well.

Mockup Link

data.wikiData: Laptops usually slows down when there are too many files and programs saved on it, as a result of regular use. To avoid this problem, we recommend you free up some space on the hard drive by deleting temporary files, keeping your desktop organised and getting rid of programs you donâ€™t regularly use. You could also transfer old files to an external hard drive to improve your laptops performance.
data.author: BHARAT.BHUSHAN

data.instructionLanguage: Hungarian - HU|Ukrainian - UK|Polish - PL|Russian - RU|Malay - MS|Chinese - ZH

data.wikiData: This is most likely due to overheating, which is usually caused due to dust build-up in the case and around the fan. If your laptop keeps shutting down more often, try cleaning it thoroughly to get rid of dust. The simplest way to do this is to blow air into the side vent. Make sure you do this when the laptop is turned off completely. If this doesnâ€™t help, you can get a cooling fan for your laptop
data.author: BHARAT.BHUSHAN
data.instructionLanguage: Hungarian - HU|Ukrainian - UK|Polish - PL|Russian - RU|Malay - MS|Chinese - ZH

data.wikiData: Laptops usually have a good battery life of over 4-5 hours, if you use it at a stretch. But if your laptopâ€™s battery drains out quickly, the first thing you should do is reduce the number of open tasks. This puts an additional drain on the battery. Avoid keeping multiple windows open and disable the bluetooth option to avoid draining your laptop battery further. Lastly, switch on the Energy Saving mode and keep the brightness low. If youâ€™re using Windows XP, go to Settings and click Power Options in your control panel. Similarly, on a Macbook, go to Settings and search for Energy Saver in System Preferences to adjust the brightness.
data.author: BHARAT.BHUSHAN
data.instructionLanguage: Hungarian - HU|Ukrainian - UK|Polish - PL|Russian - RU|Malay - MS|Chinese - ZH
